title: Co-Design-Based Integrated e-Portfolio Learning Environment Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and language learning experience
context.additional_context: Learners possess advanced expertise in the language domain as general citizens and demonstrate their competencies through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can collaboratively design an e-portfolio system following the four stages (Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation) of the Co-PIRS model.
Learners can produce self-directed reflective documents of their language learning process with over 80% completeness using an e-portfolio.
Learners can iteratively improve portfolio content at least three times based on peer feedback and instructor guidance.
Learners can create portfolios using various digital tools (e.g., Google Sites, Padlet, Notion) in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
